statement.p: At a particular temperature and acidity bacillus megaterium will doube every 0.58 hours. Suppose we begin with 1.2 grams of the bacteris. Write an equation for the amount of bacteria after \displaystyle{t} hours.

solution.p: Because the amount doubles every \displaystyle{0.58} hours the number of doublings is \displaystyle\frac{{t}}{{0.58}}. Thus we have \displaystyle{2}^{{\frac{{t}}{{0.58}}}}. The (initial) amount doubled is \displaystyle{1.2}. Thus the model is \displaystyle{b}={1.2}{\left({2}^{{\frac{{t}}{{0.58}}}}\right)}.
